renderers

Class Renderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • renderers.Renderer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BlinnPhongRenderer, PostProcessingBase, ScreenRenderer, ShadowRenderer, SkyBoxRenderer, SolidColorRenderer

    public abstract class Renderer
extends java.lang.Object
    Renderers can render the scene, do post processing effects or draw ui elements.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean active
      Determines whether the Renderer is active.
      protected int numberOfRenderedElements
      Number of rendered Meshes and Splines in last frame.
      protected int numberOfRenderedFaces
      Number of rendered faces in last frame.

      Renderer()

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getNumberOfRenderedElements()
      Returns the number of meshes and splines rendererd by this Renderer in the last frame.
      int getNumberOfRenderedFaces()
      Returns the number of faces rendererd by this Renderer in the last frame.
      boolean isActive()
      Determines whether the Renderer is active.
      abstract boolean isGeometryRenderer()
      Determines whether the Renderer is a Geometry Renderer.
      abstract boolean isUsable()
      Determines wheter this Renderer is usable.

      Releases all of the renderer's resources.
      protected abstract void removeFromRenderingPipeline()
      Administrates that it has been romoved from the rendering pipeline, releases the parameters.
      abstract void render()
      Renders the meshes and splines using this Renderer in their material, if it's a scene renderer.

      Determines whether or not the Renderer is active.

    • Field Detail

        Determines whether the Renderer is active.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Renderer

        public Renderer()

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public abstract void render()
        Renders the meshes and splines using this Renderer in their material, if it's a scene renderer. If it's not it may render post processing effects, ui elements or a shadow map.

      • release

        public abstract void release()
        Releases all of the renderer's resources. After calling this method, the render is no longer usable.

      • isUsable

        public abstract boolean isUsable()
        Determines wheter this Renderer is usable. If it returns false, you can't use if for anything.
        Returns:
        true if usable, false otherwise

      • removeFromRenderingPipeline

        protected abstract void removeFromRenderingPipeline()
        Administrates that it has been romoved from the rendering pipeline, releases the parameters.

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Determines whether the Renderer is active.
        Returns:
        true if the Renderer is active, false otherwise

      • setActive

        public void setActive(boolean active)
        Determines whether or not the Renderer is active.
        Parameters:
        active - true if the Renderer should be active, false otherwise

      • getNumberOfRenderedFaces

        public int getNumberOfRenderedFaces()
        Returns the number of faces rendererd by this Renderer in the last frame.
        Returns:
        the number of faces rendererd by this Renderer in the last frame

      • getNumberOfRenderedElements

        public int getNumberOfRenderedElements()
        Returns the number of meshes and splines rendererd by this Renderer in the last frame.
        Returns:
        the number of meshes and splines rendererd by this Renderer in the last frame

      • isGeometryRenderer

        public abstract boolean isGeometryRenderer()
        Determines whether the Renderer is a Geometry Renderer. If it's a Geometry Renderer, most likely it renders a part of the scene. If it's not (called Screen Space Renderer), it not renders any geometry from the scene, it rather performs post processing effects or draw UI elements.
        Returns:
        true if it's a Geometry Renderer, false if it's a Screen Space Renderer
